item.description:
From the MIT Museum site:
http://web.mit.edu/mu...

"2/12 Second Fridays

"Join us for our new after hours series. Enjoy the Museum galleries, additional activities, and refreshments. Free admission.

"5:00 p.m. - 8:00 p.m.

"Theme: Darwin Day

"Charles Darwin was born on February 12, 1809. Celebrate his life and work at the MIT Museum on the 201st anniversary of his birth! Learn about biological evolution and natural selection. Get a sneak peak of the new play From Orchids To Octopi: An Evolutionary Love Story, by Melinda Lopez. Watch excerpts from the upcoming production, and join in a post-play discussion. Family audiences welcome".

... T.J. believes the excerpt of the play is from 6:30 pm, to 7:00 pm.

Where to Meet:

T.J. Maher will probably be wandering the MIT Museum starting at 5:45 pm. The excerpts of the play doesn't start until 6:30 pm he thinks. Feel free to drop in! He'll try to remember to bring small red circular MEETUP stickers for people to wear to identify who are the MEETUP members. If he forgets to bring them yet again, just remember he's five foot seven, with short brown hair -- spiked in the front -- blue eyes, a "Hello My Name is T.J." nametag, and a red MEETUP sign attached to his black messenger bag. He also answers when people shout "Hey, T.J.!"

About From Orchids To Octopi: An Evolutionary Love Story:
http://www.centralsqu...

"By Melinda Lopez
"Directed by Diego Arciniegas

"March 31 - May 2

"Catalyst Collaborative@MIT - Underground Railway Theater's science theater initiative with MIT - presents this World Premiere by award-winning playwright Melinda Lopez, commissioned by the National Institutes of Health to celebrate the 150th anniversary of 'On the Origin of Species.' Surprises erupt as a muralist's work
is derailed by hallucinations, pregnancy, and dinosaurs in this witty take on how we understand - or do not - the theory of evolution. Charles Darwin comments on it all". In March the price will be $35.00.

Other happenings on Darwin Day at the MIT Museum:

"Presentations and Demos from the Whitehead Institute:

"Speak with scientists and engineers from the Whitehead Institute for Biomedical Research. Learn about how evolution is used in current biomedical research. 5:30 - 6:30 p.m".


"Sneak Peak - From Orchids To Octopi: An Evolutionary Love Story:

"Listen to excerpts from the new play From Orchids To Octopi: An Evolutionary Love Story, by Melinda Lopez, presented by Catalyst Collaborative@MIT - Underground Railway Theater's science initiative with MIT. [...] The final production will be presented at the Central Square Theatre, as part of the Cambridge Science Festival in Spring 2010. Receive a special discount pass for the final production of the play when you attend the reading! 6:30 p.m. - 7:00 p.m".

"Talk Back Discussion - Jonathan King and Debra Wise:
"Join the MIT Museum in the post-reading discussion with Jonathan King - MIT Professor of Molecular Biology, Debra Wise - the Artistic Director of the Underground Railway Theater, and the actors involved in the production. 7:00 p.m. - 7:30 p.m".

... They usually do quite well at providing a light snack for people, enough to tide people over during the event there.
item.name: Second Fridays, Darwin Day, Orchids, Octopi, and Evolution @MIT Museum
